{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:12.239
    | text      = Every sentence is a short digestible tidbit and almost all of the sentences trail off with ellipses
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:17.239
    | text      = Ending sentences and ellipses is a subtle marketing trick that's used, it elicits a couple different responses from readers
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:25.239
    | text      = The first is that it gives the impression that a thought has more to come, which inherently builds tension in the reader's mind
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:31.239
    | text      = This has the effect of making the reader less likely to get bored and stop reading because the ellipses tricks them into thinking that something big is coming
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:39.239
    | text      = The second effect ellipses have in writing is that they indicate incomplete thoughts
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:43.239
    | text      = Which allow the reader to mentally engage with the text and fill in the blank with something
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:47.239
    | text      = Which creates a subconscious connection with the reader and what's being read
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:52.239
    | text      = This is something that can be artfully done in ad copy but the way that it's being overused in this text is almost embarrassing

{{TranscriptBlock
